intro: Polycnemum fontanesii subsp. maroccanum, commonly known as the Moroccan nettle, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, typical of the genus Polycnemum. This subspecies is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and dry habitats.
